subject: JUnit, threads, and Swing

messageBody:
I have a bunch of tests that manipulate Swing obejcts. To be safe these
tests should run in the Swing event loop. I can do this by using
invokeLater() or invokeAndWait() in the test suite. Something like this:

public void setUp() {
// create a frame and make it visible;
}

public void testIt() {
SwingUtilities.invokeLater(new Runnable() {
public void run() {
// add some buttons to the frame
// invoke buttons
// assert(someCondition);
}
}
}

But this is very awkward, and (I'm guessing) that JUnit can't automatically
catch exceptions within the Swing event loop. Is there is an easier way?

-Chris
